Name: Tony
Line: It’s good to be back. You missed me?

Name: Tony
Line: I missed you too. Blow something up? I already did that. I’m not saying that the world is enjoying its longest period of uninterrupted peace in years because of me. I’m not saying that from the ashes of captivity, never has a greater phoenix metaphor been personified in human history. I’m not saying that Uncle Sam can kick back on a lawn chair, sipping on an iced tea because I haven’t come across anyone who’s man enough to go toe-to-toe with me on my best day.

Name: Tony
Line: Please, it’s not about me. [People still cheering Tony] It’s not about you. It’s not even about us. It’s about legacy. It’s about what we choose to leave behind for future generations. And that’s why for the next year and for the first time since 1974, the best and brightest men and women of nations and corporations the world over will pool their resources, share their collective vision, to leave behind a brighter future. It’s not about us. Therefore, what I’m saying, if I’m saying anything, is welcome back to the Stark Expo. [Big cheer from crowd.] And now, making a special guest appearance from the great beyond to tell you what it’s all about, please welcome my father, Howard.

Name: Tony
Line: All right, it’s a zoo out there, watch out.

Name: Happy
Line: Open up, let’s go.

Name: Tony
Line: Hey, nice to see you. All right. Thank you. I remember you.

Name: Tony
Line: Hey, hey.

Name: Happy
Line: Hey, hey, hey, hey. Come on, come on.

Name: Tony
Line: [signing a picture of Iron Man] Hello. It would be a pleasure.

Name: Happy
Line: Okay

Name: Tony
Line: [what would be ruffling the hair of a small boy if said small boy were not wearing an Iron Man helmet making hair unreachable] See you buddy

Name: Happy
Line: This is Larry.

Name: Tony
Line: Hey, the oracle of Oracle. What a pleasure. Nice to see you.

Name: Happy
Line: Larry King.

Name: Tony
Line: Larry! Larry. Yes, my people, my people.

Name: Happy
Line: [Scene shows them finally at the door] Come on, Tony. There we go.

Name: Tony
Line: Very mellow.

Name: Happy
Line: That wasn’t so bad.

Name: Tony
Line: No, it was perfect.

Name: Happy
Line: Look what we got here, the new model.

Name: Tony
Line: Hey, does she come with the car?

Name: Happy
Line: I certainly hope so. Hi.

Name: Tony
Line: Hi. And you are?

Name: Tony
Line: Irish. I like it.

Name: Tony
Line: I’m on the wheel. Do you mind? Where you from?

Name: Tony
Line: What are you doing here?

Name: Tony
Line: Yeah? You found me. What are you up to later?

Name: Tony
Line: Yikes.

Name: Happy
Line: [Reaching over and taking the letter] He doesn’t like to be handed things.

Name: Tony
Line: Yeah, I have a peeve.

Name: Tony
Line: Can I see a badge?

Name: Happy
Line: He likes the badge.

Name: Tony
Line: Yep. [Starts engine] How far are we from D.C.?

Name: Happy
Line: D.C.? 250 miles.

Name: Tony
Line: [turns around from where he was trying to talk to Pepper who looks like she was trying to tell him off.] Yes dear?

Name: Tony
Line: Absolutely.

Name: Stern
Line: Do you or do you not possess a specialised weapon?

Name: Tony
Line: I do not.

Name: Stern
Line: You do not?

Name: Tony
Line: I do not. Well, it depends on how you define the word weapon.

Name: Stern
Line: The Iron Man weapon.

Name: Tony
Line: My device does not fit that description.

Name: Stern
Line: Well… How would you describe it?

Name: Tony
Line: I would describe it by defining it as what it is, Senator.

Name: Stern
Line: As?

Name: Tony
Line: It’s a high-tech prosthesis. That is… That is… That’s actually the most apt description I can make of it.

Name: Stern
Line: It’s a weapon. It’s a weapon, Mr Stark.

Name: Tony
Line: Please, if your priority was actually the well-being of the American citizen…

Name: Stern
Line: My priority is to get the Iron Man weapon turned over to the people of the United States of America.

Name: Tony
Line: Well, you can forget it. I am Iron Man. The suit and I are one. To turn over the Iron Man suit would be to turn over myself which is tantamount to indentured servitude or prostitution, depending or what state you’re in. You can’t have it.

Name: Stern
Line: Look, I’m no expert…

Name: Tony
Line: In prostitution? Of course not. You’re a senator. Come on.

Name: Stern
Line: I’m no expert in weapons. We have somebody here who is an expert on weapons. I’d now like to call Justin Hammer, our current primary weapons contractor.

Name: Tony
Line: Let the record reflect that I observed Mr Hammer entering the chamber, and I am wondering if and when any actual expert will also be in attendance.

Name: Stern
Line: That is well said Mr Hammer. The committee would now like to invite Lieutenant Colonel James Rhodes to the chamber.

Name: Tony
Line: Rhodey? What?

Name: Tony
Line: Hey, buddy. I didn’t expect to see you here.

Name: Rhodey
Line: Look, it’s me, I’m here. Deal with it. Let’s move on.

Name: Tony
Line: I just…

Name: Rhodey
Line: Drop it.

Name: Tony
Line: All right, I’ll drop it.

Name: Stern
Line: I have before me a complete report on the Iron Man weapon, complied by Colonel Rhodes. And, Colonel, for the record, can you please read page 57, paragraph four?

Name: Rhodey
Line: You’re requesting that I read specific selections from my report, Senator?

Name: Stern
Line: Yes, sir.

Name: Rhodey
Line: It was my understanding that I was going to be testifying in a much more comprehensive and detailed manner.

Name: Stern
Line: I understand. A lot of things have changed today. So if you could just read…

Name: Rhodey
Line: You do understand that reading a single paragraph out of context does not reflect the summery of my final…

Name: Stern
Line: Just read it, Colonel. I do. Thank you.

Name: Rhodey
Line: Very well. “As he does not operate within any definable branch of government, Iron Man presents a potential threat to the security of both the nation and to her interests.” I did however, go on to summarise that the benefits of Iron Man far outweigh three liabilities and that it would be in our interest…

Name: Stern
Line: That’s enough Colonel

Name: Rhodey
Line: …to fold Mr Stark…

Name: Stern
Line: That’s enough

Name: Rhodey
Line: …into the existing chain of command, Senator.

Name: Tony
Line: I’m not a joiner, but I’ll consider Secretary of Defence, if you ask nice.

Name: Tony
Line: We can amend the hours a little bit.

Name: Stern
Line: I’d like to go on and show, if I may, the imagery that’s connected to your report.

Name: Rhodey
Line: I believe it is somewhat premature to reveal these images to the general public at this time.

Name: Stern
Line: With all due respect, Colonel, I understand. And if you could just narrate those for us, we’d be very grateful. Let’s have the images.

Name: Rhodey
Line: Intelligence suggests that the devices seen in these photos are, in fact, attempts at making manned copies of Mr Stark’s suit. This has been corroborated by our allies and local intelligence on the ground…

Name: Rhodey
Line: … indicating that these suits are quite possibly, at this moment, operational.

Name: Tony
Line: Hold on a second buddy. Let me see something here. [Sets up his device to connect with the screen showing the pictures.] Boy, I’m good. I commandeered your screens. I need them. Time for a little transparency. Now, let’s see what’s really going on.

Name: Stern
Line: What is he doing?

Name: Tony
Line: If you will direct your attention to said screens, I believe that’s North Korea. [Video of a suit. It falls over and clearly doesn’t work very well at all.]

Name: Stern
Line: Can you turn that off? Take it off. [Justin Hammer stands up]

Name: Tony
Line: Iran.

Name: Tony
Line: No grave threat here. Is that Justin Hammer? How did Hammer get in the game?

Name: Tony
Line: Justin, you’re on TV. Focus up.

Name: Tony
Line: [Just as not-TV Justin finds the plug and unplugs the screen] Wow. Yeah, I’d say most countries, five, ten years away. Hammer Industries, twenty.

Name: Justin
Line: I’d like to point out that that test pilot survived.

Name: Stern
Line: I think we’re done is the point that he’s making. I don’t think there’s any reason…

Name: Tony
Line: The point is, you’re welcome, I guess

Name: Stern
Line: For what?

Name: Tony
Line: Because I’m your nuclear deterrent. It’s working. We’re safe. America is secure. You want my property? You can’t have it. But I did you a big favour.

Name: Tony
Line: I’ve successfully privatised world peace.

Name: Tony
Line: What more do you want? For now! I tried to play ball with these ass-clowns.

Name: Stern
Line: [beep] you, Mr Stark. [beep] you, buddy. We’re adjourned. We’re adjourned for today.

Name: Tony
Line: [puts on sunglasses. Rhodey’s still sitting down and has the same look on his face as Pepper did. Basically, they’re both tired of Tony not taking serious things seriously] Okay.

Name: Stern
Line: You’ve been a delight.

Name: Tony
Line: Wake up, Daddy’s home.

Name: Tony
Line: You!

Name: Tony
Line: I swear to God I’ll dismantle you. I’ll soak your motherboard. I’ll turn you into a wine rack.

Name: Tony
Line: How many ounce a day of this gobbledegook am I supposed to drink?

Name: Jarvis
Line: We are up to 80 ounces a day to counteract the symptoms, sir.

Name: Tony
Line: Check palladium levels.

Name: Jarvis
Line: Blood toxicity, 24%. It appears that the continued use of the Iron Man suit is accelerating your condition. Another core has been depleted.

Name: Tony
Line: [Takes Arc Reactor out of chest. The core pops out, rusted and slightly smoking.] God, they’re running out quick.

Name: Jarvis
Line: I have run simulations on every known element, and none can serve as a viable replacement for the palladium core.

Name: Jarvis
Line: You are running out of both time and options. Unfortunately, the device that’s keeping you alive is also killing you.

Name: Jarvis
Line: Miss Potts is approaching. I recommend that you inform her…

Name: Tony
Line: Mute.

Name: Pepper
Line: Is this a joke? What are you thinking?

Name: Tony
Line: What?

Name: Pepper
Line: What are you thinking?

Name: Tony
Line: Hey, I’m thinking I’m busy. And you’re angry about something. Do you have the sniffles? I don’t want to get sick.

Name: Pepper
Line: Did you just donate…

Name: Tony
Line: Keep your business.

Name: Pepper
Line: …our entire modern art collection to the…

Name: Tony
Line: Boy Scouts of America.

Name: Pepper
Line: …Boy Scouts of America?

Name: Tony
Line: Yes. It is a worthwhile organisation. I didn’t physically check the crates but, basically, yes. And it’s not “our” collection, it’s my collection. No offence.

Name: Pepper
Line: No, you know what? I think I’m actually entitled to say “our” collection considering the time that I put in, over 10 years, curating that.

Name: Tony
Line: It was a tax write-off. I needed that.

Name: Pepper
Line: You know, there’s only about 8,011 things that I really need to talk to you about.

Name: Tony
Line: [to another robot] Dummy. Hey, stop spacing out. The Bridgeport’s already machining that part.

Name: Pepper
Line: The Expo is a gigantic waste of time.

Name: Tony
Line: I need you to wear a surgical mask until you’re feeling better. Is that okay?

Name: Pepper
Line: That’s rude.

Name: Tony
Line: There’s nothing more important to me than the Expo. It’s my primary point of concern. I don’t know why you’re…

Name: Pepper
Line: The Expo is your ego gone crazy.

Name: Tony
Line: [Picking up a painting. Of Iron Man] Wow. Look at that. That’s modern art. That’s going up.

Name: Pepper
Line: You’ve got to be kidding.

Name: Tony
Line: I’m gonna put this up right now. This is vital.

Name: Pepper
Line: Stark is in complete disarray. You understand that?

Name: Tony
Line: No. Our stocks have never been higher.

Name: Pepper
Line: Yes, from a managerial standpoint.

Name: Tony
Line: You are… Well, if’s messy then let’s double back.

Name: Pepper
Line: Let me give you an example.

Name: Tony
Line: Let’s move onto another subject.

Name: Pepper
Line: No, no, no, no. You are not taking down the Barnett Newman and hanging that up.

Name: Tony
Line: I’m not taking it down. I’m just replacing it with this.

Name: Tony
Line: Let’s see what I can get going on here.

Name: Pepper
Line: Okay, fine. My point is, we have already awarded contracts to the wind farm people.

Name: Tony
Line: Yeah. Don’t say “wind farm.” I’m already feeling gassy.

Name: Pepper
Line: And to the plastic plantation tree, which was your idea by the way. Those people are on payroll…

Name: Tony
Line: Everything was my idea.

Name: Pepper
Line: …and you won’t make a decision.

Name: Tony
Line: I don’t care about the liberal agenda any more. It’s boring. Boring. I’m giving you a boring alert. [Jumps off desk] You do it.

Name: Pepper
Line: I do what?

Name: Tony
Line: Excellent idea. I just figured this out. You run the company.

Name: Pepper
Line: Yeah, I’m trying to run the company.

Name: Tony
Line: Pepper, I need you to run the company. Well, stop trying to do it and do it.

Name: Pepper
Line: You will not give me the information…

Name: Tony
Line: I’m not asking you to try…

Name: Pepper
Line: …in order to…

Name: Tony
Line: I’m asking you to physically do it. I need you to do it.

Name: Pepper
Line: I am trying to do it.

Name: Tony
Line: Pepper, you’re not listening to me!

Name: Pepper
Line: No, you are not listening to me.

Name: Tony
Line: I’m trying to make you CEO. Why won’t you let me?

Name: Pepper
Line: Have you been drinking?

Name: Tony
Line: Chlorophyll. I hereby irrevocably appoint you chairman and CEO of Stark Industries effective immediately. Yeah, done deal. Okay? I’ve actually given this a fair amount of thought, believe it or not. [One of the robots brings him a tray which a bottle and glasses on it] Doing a bit of headhunting, so to speak, trying to figure out who a worthy successor would be. And then I realised it’s you. It’s always been you. [Pours champagne. Pepper sits down, shocked and confused]. I thought there’d be a legal issue, but actually I’m capable of appointing my successor. My successor being you. [Hands her a glass. She doesn’t take it.] Congratulations? Take it, just take it.

Name: Pepper
Line: I don’t know what to think.

Name: Tony
Line: Don’t think, drink. There you go. [They tap glasses and drink]

Name: Pepper
Line: The notary’s here! Can you please come sign the transfer paperwork?

Name: Tony
Line: I’m on happy time. [Tony hits Happy in the face with his elbow] Sorry.

Name: Happy
Line: What the hell was that?

Name: Tony
Line: It’s called mixed martial arts. It’s been around for three weeks.

Name: Happy
Line: It’s called dirty boxing, there’s nothing new about it

Name: Tony
Line: All right, put them up. Come on. [The Notary walks in. Both Happy and Tony’s attention shifts to her]

Name: Pepper
Line: I promise this is the only time I will ask you to sign over your company.

Name: Happy
Line: [Taps Tony on the back of the head with a light punch, not enough to hurt him] Lesson one. Never take your eye off… [Tony kicks him and he goes crashing into the corner of the ring. Camera angle shifts to Pepper and the Notary and clangs are heard.]

Name: Tony
Line: That’s it. I’m done. What’s your name, lady?

Name: Tony
Line: Front and centre. Come into the church.

Name: Pepper
Line: No. You’re seriously not gonna ask…

Name: Tony
Line: If it pleases the court, which it does.

Name: Natalie
Line: [To Pepper] It’s no problem.

Name: Pepper
Line: [To Natalie] I’m sorry. He’s very eccentric.

Name: Tony
Line: Can you give her a lesson?

Name: Happy
Line: No problem.

Name: Tony
Line: [Steps out of ring and towards Pepper] Pepper.

Name: Pepper
Line: What?

Name: Tony
Line: [Sitting down next to Pepper] Who is she?

Name: Pepper
Line: She is from legal. And she is potentially a very expensive sexual harassment lawsuit if you keep ogling her like that.

Name: Tony
Line: I need a new assistant, boss.

Name: Pepper
Line: Yes, and I’ve got three excellent potential candidates. They’re lined up and ready to meet you.

Name: Tony
Line: I don’t have time to meet. I need someone now. I feel like it’s her.

Name: Pepper
Line: No, it’s not.

Name: Happy
Line: You ever boxed before?

Name: Natalie
Line: I have, yes.

Name: Happy
Line: What, like, the Tae Bo? Booty Boot Camp? Crunch? Something like that? [Natalie’s face shows brief annoyance at his statement before Tony distracts her]

Name: Tony
Line: How do I spell your name, Natalie?

Name: Natalie
Line: R-U-S-H-M-A-N.

Name: Pepper
Line: What, are you gonna google her now?

Name: Tony
Line: I thought I was ogling her. [Brings up Natalie’s file on table which doubles up as a computer. He has computers on everything.] Wow. Very, very impressive individual.

Name: Pepper
Line: You’re so predictable, you know that?

Name: Tony
Line: She’s fluent in French, Italian, Russian, Latin. Who speaks Latin?

Name: Pepper
Line: No one speaks Latin.

Name: Tony
Line: No one speaks Latin

Name: Pepper
Line: It’s a dead language. You can read Latin or you can write Latin, but you can’t speak Latin.

Name: Tony
Line: Did you model in Tokyo? ‘Cause she modelled in Tokyo.

Name: Pepper
Line: Well…

Name: Tony
Line: I need her. She’s got everything that I need. [Camera is now on Natalie and Happy, Natalie looking over, hearing what Tony is saying]

Name: Happy
Line: Rule number one, never take your eyes off your opponent. [He goes to take a swing, she grabs his hand and flips him over, legs over his head.]

Name: Pepper
Line: Oh, my God! Happy.

Name: Tony
Line: That’s what I’m talking about.

Name: Happy
Line: I just slipped.

Name: Tony
Line: You did?

Name: Happy
Line: [Who looks a little like he’s in pain] Yeah.

Name: Tony
Line: Looks like a TKO to me. [Rings the bell and Natalie leaves the ring]

Name: Natalie
Line: Just… I need your impression.

Name: Tony
Line: You have a quiet reserve. I don’t know, you have an old soul.

Name: Natalie
Line: I meant your fingerprint.

Name: Tony
Line: Right.

Name: Pepper
Line: So, how are we doing?

Name: Tony
Line: Great. Just wrapping up here. Hey. You’re the boss.

Name: Natalie
Line: Will that be all, Mr Stark?

Name: Tony
Line: No.

Name: Pepper
Line: Yes, that will be all, Ms Rushman. Thank you very much. [She leaves. Tony turns to Pepper]

Name: Tony
Line: I want one.

Name: Pepper
Line: No.

Name: Tony
Line: You know, it’s Europe. Whatever happens the next 20 minutes, just go with it.

Line: Go with it? Go with what?

Line: Mr Stark?

Name: Tony
Line: Hey.

Name: Natalie
Line: Hello. How was your flight?

Name: Tony
Line: It was excellent. Boy, it’s nice to see you.

Name: Natalie
Line: We have one photographer from the ACM, if you don’t mind. Okay?

Name: Pepper
Line: When did this happen?

Name: Tony
Line: What? You made me do it.

Name: Pepper
Line: I made you do what?

Name: Tony
Line: You quit. Smile. Look, right there. Stop acting constipated. Don’t flare your nostrils.

Name: Pepper
Line: You are so predictable.

Name: Tony
Line: That’s the amazing thing.

Name: Natalie
Line: Right this way.

Name: Tony
Line: You look fantastic.

Name: Natalie
Line: Why, thank you very much.

Line: But that’s unprofessional. What’s on the docket?

Line: You have a 9

Line: Perfect. I’ll be there at 11

Line: Absolutely.

Line: Is this us?

Line: It can be.

Line: Great. Make it us.

Line: Okay.

Line: Mr Musk. How are you?

Line: Thank you very much.

Line: Elon, how’s it going. Those Merlin engines are fantastic.

Name: Tony
Line: You do?

Line: Then we’ll make it work. [To Pepper as they walk] You want a massage?

Line: Oh, God. No. I don’t want a massage.

Name: Tony
Line: I’ll have Natalie make an…

Name: Pepper
Line: I don’t want Natalie to do…

Line: Don’t want you tense. By the way, I didn’t mean to spring this on you.

Name: Pepper
Line: Thank you very much.

Line: Green is not your best colour. [Justin’s head appears from behind someone]

Name: Pepper
Line: Oh, please.

Name: Justin
Line: Anthony. Is that you?

Name: Tony
Line: [To Pepper] My least favourite person on Earth.

Name: Justin
Line: Hey, pal.

Name: Tony
Line: Justin Hammer.

Name: Justin
Line: How you doing? You’re not the only rich guy here with a fancy car. You know Christine Everhart from Vanity Fair. You guys know each other? [She appears.]

Line: Hi. Yes.

Line: Yes.

Line: Yes, roughly.

Name: Pepper
Line: We do.

Line: BTW, big story. The new CEO of Stark Industries.

Name: Christine
Line: I know, I know.

Name: Justin
Line: Congratulations.

Line: Oh.

Line: Can I?

Line: Sure.

Name: Justin
Line: She’s actually doing a big spread on me for Vanity Fair. I thought I’d throw her a bone, you know. Right?

Line: Right. Well, she did quite a spread on Tony last year.

Line: And she wrote a story as well.

Name: Pepper
Line: It was very impressive.

Line: That was good.

Line: It was very well done.

Name: Christine
Line: Thank you.

Line: I’m gonna go wash.

Line: Don’t leave me.

Line: Hey, buddy. How you doing?

Name: Tony
Line: I’m all right.

Name: Justin
Line: Looking gorgeous.

Name: Tony
Line: Please, this is tough.

Name: Christine
Line: Can I ask you… Is this the first time…

Name: Justin
Line: [Posing for a camera while Tony replaces sunglasses and tries to escape] Fromage [French for cheese. That bit did have a subtitle] Say “Brie”.

Name: Christine
Line: …that you guys have seen each other?

Name: Tony
Line: God, that’s so awful.

Name: Christine
Line: Listen, is it the first time you’ve seen each other since the Senate?

Name: Tony
Line: Since he got his contract revoked…

Name: Justin
Line: Actually, it’s on hold.

Name: Tony
Line: …when you were attempting to…That’s not what I heard. What’s the difference between “hold and “cancelled”? The truth?

Name: Christine
Line: Yes, what is it?

Name: Justin
Line: No. The truth is… Why don’t we put that away? The truth is, I’m actually hoping to present something at your Expo.

Name: Tony
Line: Well, if you invent something that works, I’ll make sure I get you a slot.

Name: Natalie
Line: Mr Stark?

Name: Tony
Line: Yes?

Name: Natalie
Line: Your corner table is ready.

Name: Justin
Line: I actually have a slot this year. Yes, I do.

Name: Tony
Line: Hammer needs a slot, Christine.

Name: Justin
Line: We kid, yeah. We kid. We’re kidders.

Name: Tony
Line: [In the mirror] Got any other bad ideas?

Name: Justin
Line: [Still inside, talking to Christine.] Tony and I… Tony… I love Tony Stark. Tony loves me. We’re not competitors. Him being out of the picture created tremendous opportunities for Hammer Industries, you know? Everything that Tony and I do…

Name: Justin
Line: …is a healthy…

Name: Tony
Line: …and owning a race car…

Name: Justin
Line: …competition.

Line: …if you don’t drive it?

Line: Is he driving?

Line: Natalie. Natalie!

Line: Yes, Ms Potts?

Line: What do you know about this?

Line: This is the first that I have known of it.

Line: This, this cannot happen.

Line: Absolutely. I understand. How can I help you?

Line: Where’s Happy?

Line: He’s waiting outside.

Line: Okay, get him. I need Happy.

Line: Right away.

Line: Tony’s… You know, he… We’re not competitive. You know what I mean?

Line: Yeah, yeah, yeah. You know, can you excuse me just one second?

Line: Just read me what you wrote.

Name: Christine
Line: I will. I will, after.

Line: Just read it back to me.

Line: But I have to make one quick phone call.

Name: Justin
Line: Where are you going?

Name: Christine
Line: This is great.

Name: Justin
Line: I’ve got some caviar coming.

Name: Christine
Line: This is great stuff. I’ll be right back.

Name: Pepper
Line: Go, go.

Name: Happy
Line: Hang on. [Crashes through a barrier onto the track heading the opposite way to the race cars. Tony’s car gets hit and he goes flying, loosing the front. Ivan heads forward. Another car gets hit. Bit of fire. Dripping petrol. Never a good sign.]

Line: Give me the case.

Name: Happy
Line: Here, take it.

Line: Where’s the key?

Line: It’s in my pocket.

Name: Pepper
Line: Car!

Line: Are you okay?

Line: Yeah.

Line: Were you heading from me or him?

Line: I was trying to scare him.

Line: ‘Cause I can’t tell!

Line: Are you out of your mind?

Line: Better security.

Name: Pepper
Line: Get in the car right now!

Name: Tony
Line: I was attacked. We need better security.

Name: Happy
Line: Get in the car.

Name: Tony
Line: You’re CEO. Better security measures. God, it’s embarrassing. [Ivan’s head moves. Tony opens the door] First vacation in two years. [And Ivan slices the door in half. Darn it Ivan, it’s a Rolls, be nicer to her]

Name: Pepper
Line: Oh my God! [Happy reverses a bit and runs into Ivan again.]

Name: Happy
Line: I got him!

Line: Hit him again. Hit him again. Football.

Line: I got him.

Line: Take the case! Take it!

Name: Tony
Line: Give him the case!

Name: Pepper
Line: Stop banging the car! [Out comes the airbag and Ivan slices the car in half. He continues to slice at the car]

Name: Tony
Line: Calm down.

Name: Pepper
Line: God. God.

Name: Tony
Line: Give me the case! Please! Come on! [Pepper throws the case, Tony stand on it and it turns into the Iron Man Suit! A fight begins. Which involves more damage to the car and damage to the Iron Man suit. Tony rips out the Arc Reactor, shutting off Ivan’s suit.]

Name: Ivan
Line: [Being taken away by the police] You… You lose. You lose Stark. [Justin smiles.]

Name: Tony
Line: Pretty decent tech. Cycles per second were a little low. You could have doubled up your rotations. You focused the repulsor energy through ionised plasma channels. It’s effective. Not very efficient. But it’s a passable knock-off. I don’t get it. A little fine tuning you could have made a solid pay check. You could have sold it to North Korea, China, Iran, or gone onto the black market. You look like you got friends in low places.

Name: Ivan
Line: You come from a family of thieves and butchers. And now, like all guilty men, you try to rewrite your own history. And you forget all the lives the Stark family has destroyed.

Name: Tony
Line: Speaking of thieves, where did you get this design?

Name: Ivan
Line: My father. Anton Vanko.

Name: Tony
Line: Well, I never heard of him.

Name: Ivan
Line: My father is the reason you’re alive.

Name: Tony
Line: The reason I’m alive is ‘cause you had a shot, you took it, you missed.

Name: Ivan
Line: Did I? If you can make God bleed, the people will cease to believe in him. And there will be blood in the water. And the sharks will come. The truth, all I have to do is sit here and watch as the world will consume you.

Name: Tony
Line: Where will you be watching the world consume me from? That’s right. A prison cell. I’ll send you a bar of soap. [He gets up to leave]

Name: Ivan
Line: Hey, Tony. Before you go, palladium in the chest, painful way to die. [Tony leaves the cell]

Name: Stern
Line: It’s just unbelievable. It proves that the genie is out of the bottle and this man has no idea what he’s doing. He thinks of the Iron Man weapon as a toy. I was at a hearing where Mr Stark, in fact, was adamant that these suits can’t exist anywhere else, don’t exist anywhere else, never will exist anywhere else, at least for five to ten years, and here we are in Monaco realising, “These suits exist now.”

Name: Tony
Line: Mute. He should be giving me a medal. That’s the truth.

Name: Pepper
Line: What is that?

Name: Tony
Line: This is your in-flight meal.

Name: Pepper
Line: Did you just make that?

Name: Tony
Line: Yeah. Where do you think I’ve been for three hours?

Name: Pepper
Line: Tony, what are you not telling me?

Name: Tony
Line: I don’t want to go home. At all. Let’s cancel my birthday party and… We’re in Europe. Let’s go to Venice, Cipriani. Remember?

Name: Pepper
Line: Oh, yes.

Name: Tony
Line: It’s a great place to be healthy.

Name: Pepper
Line: I don’t think this is the right time. We’re in kind of a mess.

Name: Tony
Line: Yeah, but maybe that’s why it’s the best time. ‘Cause then we can…

Name: Pepper
Line: Well, I think as the CEO I need to show up.

Name: Tony
Line: As CEO, you are entitled to a leave.

Name: Pepper
Line: A leave?

Name: Tony
Line: A company retreat.

Name: Pepper
Line: A retreat? During a time like this?

Name: Tony
Line: Just a ride. Well, I’m just saying, to recharge our batteries and figure it all out.

Name: Pepper
Line: Not everybody runs on batteries Tony.

Name: Justin
Line: Hey. There he is. There he is. What an absolute pleasure. Welcome. Oh goodness gracious. Can we get the handcuffs off my friend here? Forgive me, I’m sorry. I’m such a huge fan of yours. I didn’t want to make a first impression like this. He’s not an animal. Come on. He’s a human being. Thank you. We’re fine. My name is Justin Hammer. I’d like to do some business with you. Please sit. Dig in. What do we have today Jack?

Name: Justin
Line: Salmon carpaccio. Anything you want here, we got it. I like my dessert first. I had this flown in from San Francisco. It’s Italian though. Organic ice cream. I got a sweet tooth. Apparently you do too, for Tony Stark. What I saw you do to Tony Stark on that track, how you stepped up to him in front of God and everybody that was… Wow. You spoke to me with what you did. And I know that you knew that I’d be listening. This is why I couldn’t bear to have you shipped off to God knows where. It would have been such a waste of talent. But if I might make a suggestion, you know, you don’t just go and try to kill the guy. I think, if I may, you go after his legacy. That’s what you kill. You and me, we are a lot alike in a lot of ways. The only difference between you and I is that I have resources. I think, if I may, you need my resources. Someone behind you, a benefactor. I’d like to be that guy.

Name: Ivan
Line: [Russian; no subs unintelligible]

Name: Justin
Line: Okay. Do you speak English? Because I can get a translator. I don’t know. Have you been understanding everything I’m saying?

Name: Ivan
Line: Very good, man.

Name: Justin
Line: Very good, man.

Name: Ivan
Line: Very good, man.

Name: Justin
Line: Hey!

Name: Ivan
Line: [clinking bottle with Justin’s glass] Hey.

Name: Justin
Line: Yes?

Name: Ivan
Line: I want my bird.

Name: Justin
Line: A bird? You want a bird?

Name: Ivan
Line: I want my bird.

Name: Justin
Line: I can get you a bird. I can get you ten birds.

Name: Ivan
Line: I want my bird.

Name: Justin
Line: Well, okay. Nothing’s impossible. I could… Are we talking about… Is this a bird back in Russia?

Name: Pepper
Line: [on phone] Yes, but the fundamentals of the company are still very, very strong despite the events in Monaco.

Name: Natalie
Line: [also on phone. But a different phone] Yes, of course. [To Pepper] The AP wants a quote.

Name: Pepper
Line: [covers speaker] Don’t tell them. Fax them…

Name: Rhodey
Line: [entering] Where is he?

Name: Natalie
Line: He doesn’t want to be disturbed.

Name: Pepper
Line: He’s downstairs.

Name: Pepper
Line: Yes, but….

Name: Pepper
Line: Iron Man never stopped protecting us. The events in Monaco proved that.

Name: Rhodey
Line: Tony, you gotta get upstairs and get on top of this situation right now. Listen. I’ve been on the phone with the National Guard all day, trying to talk them out of rolling tanks up the PCH, knocking down your front door and taking these. They’re gonna take your suits, Tony, okay? They’re sick of the games. You said nobody else would possess this technology for 20 years. Well, guess what? Somebody else had it yesterday. It’s not theoretical anymore. Are you listening to me? Are you okay?

Name: Tony
Line: Let’s go. [Gets out the car. And falls.]

Name: Rhodey
Line: Hey, man. Hey, hey! You all right?

Name: Tony
Line: Yeah, I should get to my desk. [Rhodey supports him] See that cigar box?

Name: Rhodey
Line: Yeah.

Name: Tony
Line: It’s palladium.

Name: Rhodey
Line: [Tony removes Arc Reactor] Is that supposed to be smoking?

Name: Tony
Line: If you must know, it’s neutron damage. It’s from the reactor wall.

Name: Rhodey
Line: You had this in your body? And how about the high-tech crossword puzzle on your neck?

Name: Tony
Line: Road rash. Thank you. [Replaces Arc Reactor and starts drinking green liquid again.] What are you looking at?

Name: Rhodey
Line: I’m looking at you. You wanna do this whole lone gunslinger act and it’s unnecessary. You don’t have to do this alone.

Name: Tony
Line: You know, I wish I could believe that. I really do. But you’ve gotta trust me. Contrary to popular belief, I know exactly what I’m doing.

Name: Justin
Line: This is where we do it. This is my humble abode. You can work in absolute peace. Must be fun to be dead, right? No pressure. Here they are. I’m very excited. They’re combat-ready. I may have done a few miscalculations and rushed the prototype into production. Sue me, I’m enthusiastic. Go ahead, take a look around. [Ivan puts on glasses and heads towards a computer] You don’t wanna do that. You’ll be able to access that as soon as we generate some encrypted pass codes. Can we generate some encrypted pass codes? Get some of those encrypted pass codes, Jack. Never mind, I… Wow. Okay. Good stuff.

Name: Ivan
Line: [Something Russian] unintelligible

Name: Justin
Line: Sorry?

Name: Ivan
Line: Software shit.

Name: Justin
Line: Well… You’re good. You really blasted in past the firewall there. Let me show you where you’re gonna be working primarily. Go ahead, take a look. Get a good look at that. That’s something, isn’t it? You know, those are really just for show and tell. They’re $125.7 million a pop, so… Wait! [Ivan pulls off one’s head] Oh gosh. Jesus Christ. Get somebody up here. That’s where the pilot goes. I’m having a tough time finding volunteers. I’ll take care of that, just leave it.

Name: Ivan
Line: What you want them do?

Name: Justin
Line: Well, long term, I want them to put me in the Pentagon for the next 25 years. I want to make Iron Man look like an antique. I wanna go to that Stark Expo, I wanna take a dump in Tony Stark’s front yard. You know what I’m talking about?

Name: Ivan
Line: I can do that. No problem.

Name: Justin
Line: Yeah? Hey, fabulous! I love it. Hey, this is our guy. Didn’t I tell you? I had a feeling.

Name: Natalie
Line: Do you know which watch you’d like to wear tonight, Mr Stark?

Name: Tony
Line: I’ll give them a look. I should cancel the party.

Name: Natalie
Line: Probably.

Name: Tony
Line: Yeah. ‘Cause it’s…

Name: Natalie
Line: Ill-timed.

Name: Tony
Line: Right, sends the wrong message.

Name: Natalie
Line: Inappropriate. [Tony drinks a bit of his drink that Natalie hands him] Is that dirty enough for you?

Name: Tony
Line: Gold face, brown hand. The Jaeger. I’ll give that a look. Bring them over. [Natalie hands him the box of watches] I’ll take that. Why don’t you… [She sits, smiles softly and starts helping him cover his bruise] I gotta say it. It’s hard to get a read on you. Where are you from?

Name: Natalie
Line: Legal.

Name: Tony
Line: Can I ask you a question, hypothetically? Bit odd. If this was your last birthday party you were ever gonna have, how would you celebrate it?

Name: Natalie
Line: I’d do whatever I wanted to do with whoever I wanted to do it with. [She leaves Tony finishes his drink. Scene change. He’s now drunk, by a DJ, dancing in the suit. Cars pull up outside]

Name: Rhodey
Line: Yes, sir, I understand. No. No, sir, that will not be necessary. I’ll handle it. Sir, I personally guarantee that within 24 hours, Iron Man will be back on watch. [Enters party] Hey Pepper.

Name: Pepper
Line: I’m going to get some air.

Name: Rhodey
Line: What’s wrong?

Name: Pepper
Line: [Showing Rhodey Tony] I don’t know what to do.

Name: Rhodey
Line: You gotta be kidding me. [Tony falls over, drunk] That’s it, I’m making….

Name: Pepper
Line: No, no, no. Don’t call anyone.

Name: Rhodey
Line: Pepper. This is ridiculous. I just stuck my neck out for this guy.

Name: Pepper
Line: I know. I know. I get it. I’m gonna handle it, okay Just let me handle it.

Name: Rhodey
Line: Handle it. Or I’m gonna have to.

Name: Tony
Line: [To crowd] You know, the question I get asked most often is, “Tony, how do you go to the bathroom in the suit?” Just like that. [Cheering. Pepper walks up to him]

Name: Pepper
Line: Does this guy know how to throw a party or what?

Name: Tony
Line: I love you.

Name: Pepper
Line: Unbelievable! Thank you so much. Tony, we all thank you so much for such a wonderful night. And we’re gonna say good night now, and thank you all for coming.

Name: Tony
Line: No, no, no, we can’t … Wait, wait, wait. We didn’t have the cake. We didn’t blow out the candles.

Name: Pepper
Line: You’re out of control, okay? Trust me on this, okay?

Name: Tony
Line: You’re out of control gorgeous.

Name: Pepper
Line: It’s time to go to bed. It’s time.

Name: Tony
Line: Give me another smooch

Name: Pepper
Line: You’re not going to be happy about this.

Name: Tony
Line: Come on, you know you want to.

Name: Pepper
Line: You just peed in the suit.

Name: Tony
Line: I know. It has a filtration system.

Name: Pepper
Line: It’s not sexy.

Name: Tony
Line: You could drink that water.

Name: Pepper
Line: Just send everybody home, okay? It’s time to…

Name: Tony
Line: If you say so.

Name: Pepper
Line: Okay. I’ll take this, you take that [exchanges microphone for bottle]

Name: Tony
Line: Pepper Potts. She’s right. The party’s over. Then again, the party was over for me, like, an hour and a half ago. The after-party starts in 15 minutes. And if anybody, Pepper, doesn’t like it, there’s the door. [accidently shoots it with the suit.] Yeah! [Girl throws bottle it the air] Hit! [Rhodey leaves as he shoots it] Pull! [Rhodey goes downstairs. Drunk girl is still throwing things for Tony to shoot. Rhodey gets into one of the suits. Another girl appears with a watermelon] I think she wants the Gallagher!

Name: Rhodey
Line: [In full suit] I’m only gonna say this once. Get out. [Helmet slips down. Everybody leaves.] You don’t deserve to wear one of these. Shut it down!

Name: Tony
Line: [To DJ] Goldstein.

Name: Tony
Line: Give me a phat beat to beat my buddy’s ass to. [Laughs. Another One Bites the Dust by Queen starts to play.]

Name: Rhodey
Line: [Grabbing hold on Tony from behind] I told you to shut it down. [Tony takes off backwards]

Name: Tony
Line: Now, put that thing back where you found it before someone gets hurt. [Rhodey throws things at him] Really? [Tony hits him with a set of weights] Sorry, pal, but Iron Man doesn’t have a sidekick.

Name: Rhodey
Line: [Hitting Tony with a pipe] Sidekick this. [Tony goes up throw the ceiling.] Had enough?

Name: Pepper
Line: Natalie!

Name: Natalie
Line: Miss Potts.

Name: Pepper
Line: Don’t you “Miss Potts” me! I’m on to you. You know what? Ever since you came here… [Tony and Rhodey come crashing through the ceiling]

Name: Happy
Line: Pepper! [Runs in to get her out of the way] Get out of here. Get out of here now. [Natalie heads off somewhere.]

Name: Tony
Line: You want it? Take it! [Beats Rhodey and turns to growl at crowd, who run off. Rhodey gets back up]

Name: Rhodey
Line: Put you hand down.

Name: Tony
Line: You think you got what it takes to wear that suit?

Name: Rhodey
Line: We don’t have to do this, Tony.

Name: Tony
Line: You wanna be the War Machine, take your shot.

Name: Rhodey
Line: Put it down!

Name: Tony
Line: You gonna take a shot?

Name: Rhodey
Line: Put it down!

Name: Tony
Line: No!

Name: Rhodey
Line: Drop it Tony!

Name: Tony
Line: Take it! [Their blasts meet and there goes Tony’s house. Both of them are knocked backwards. Tony looks around and sees Rhodey take off in the suit.]

Name: Rhodey
Line: Edwards Tower, this is Lieutenant Colonel James Rhodes, inbound from three miles east at 5,000 feet… [Rhodey lands in suit.]

Name: Rhodey
Line: Major.

Name: Rhodey
Line: Yeah. Let’s take it inside.

Name: Tony
Line: [Now inside sitting at a table with Fury] I told you I don’t wanna join your super-secret boy band.

Name: Fury
Line: No, no, no. See, I remember, you do everything yourself. How’s that working out for you?

Name: Tony
Line: It’s… It’s… It’s… I’m sorry. I don’t wanna get off on the wrong foot. Do I look at the patch or the eye? Honestly I’m a bit hung over. I’m not sure if you’re real of if I’m having…

Name: Fury
Line: I am very real. I’m the realest person you’re ever gonna meet.

Name: Tony
Line: Just my luck. Where’s the staff here?

Name: Fury
Line: That’s not looking so good.

Name: Tony
Line: I’ve been worse. [A woman walks over. Camera angle is such that you can’t see her face.]

Name: Tony
Line: [Looks over top of glasses. Sees Natalie.] You’re fired.

Name: Natalie
Line: That’s not up to you. [Sits down next to Fury]

Name: Fury
Line: Tony, I want you to meet Agent Romanoff.

Name: Tony
Line: Hi.

Name: Tony
Line: I suggest you apologise.

Name: Fury
Line: You’ve been very busy. You made your girl your CEO, you’re giving away all your stuff. You let your friend fly away with your suit. Now, if I didn’t know better…

Name: Tony
Line: You don’t know better. I didn’t give it to him. He took it.

Name: Fury
Line: Whoa, whoa, whoa. He took it? You’re Iron Man and he just took it? The little brother walked in there, kicked your ass and took your suit? [Turns to Agent Romanoff] Is that possible?

Name: Tony
Line: What do you want from me?

Name: Fury
Line: What do we want from you? What do you want from me? [Agent Romanoff leaves] You have become a problem, a problem I have to deal with. Contrary to your belief, you are not the centre of my universe. I have bigger problems than you in the southwest region to deal with. [Romanoff returns with an injection] Hit him.

Name: Tony
Line: Oh, God, are gonna steal my kidney and sell it? [Rash goes down] Could you please not do anything awful for five seconds? What did she just do to me?

Name: Fury
Line: What did we just do for you? That’s lithium dioxide. It’s gonna take the edge off. We’re trying to get you back to work.

Name: Tony
Line: Give me a couple of boxes of that. I’ll be right as rain.

Name: Fury
Line: Doesn’t look like it’s gonna be an easy fix.

Name: Tony
Line: Trust me, I know. I’m good at this stuff. I’ve been looking for a suitable replacement for palladium. I’ve tried every combination, every permutation of every known element.

Name: Fury
Line: Well, I’m here to tell you, you haven’t tried them all.

Name: Justin
Line: Hey, hey, het. Special delivery. Candygram. [Ivan climbs down from where he was working] I brought you something. Oh yeah. [Removes cloth] We got you the bird, pal.

Name: Ivan
Line: This is not my bird.

Name: Justin
Line: What do you mean? That’s the bird. This is the bird. Yeah, pulled a lot of strings to get this bird. This is a great bird.

Name: Justin
Line: We got this bird all the way from Russia.

Name: Ivan
Line: Hey, man, this is not my bird.

Name: Justin
Line: Well, listen, even if it’s not the bird, I mean, this is a gorgeous bird. I mean, you know, look, don’t get so attached to things. Learn to let go. Wait a minute. Jack, what is that? Is that… That’s not a helmet. What is that? [Walks up to suit] Ivan… What’s this? Jack. Is that a helmet? It doesn’t look like a helmet to me. How… How are you supposed to get a head in there? Jack, could you put your head in there?

Name: Justin
Line: Try to put your head in there. Go ahead. Try to put your head in there. [Jack put it on his head] See, Ivan? He can’t put his head in there. That’s… That’s not a helmet. It’s a head. I need to put a guy in there. I need to fit a person in that suit. You understand?

Name: Ivan
Line: Drone better.

Name: Justin
Line: What? Drone better? Why is drone better? Why is drone better?

Name: Ivan
Line: People make problem. Trust me. Drone better.

Name: Justin
Line: Ivan, you know, I like you. I got you the bird. You said, “No problem.” That’s what you said to me. You said, “No problem.” Now I need suits. The government wants suits. Like Iron Man. You understand? That’s what the people want. That’s what’s gonna make them happy.

Name: Ivan
Line: Hey, man. Don’t get too attached to things. Learn to let go.

Name: Justin
Line: These drones better steal the show, Ivan. You understand? Better rock my world, Ivan.

Name: Rhodey
Line: Fully mission-capable.

Name: Rhodey
Line: Sir?

Name: Rhodey
Line: Sir, I don’t believe that the Expo…

Name: Rhodey
Line: Yes, General, but…

Name: Rhodey
Line: Yes sir.

Name: Rhodey
Line: Thank you sir.

Name: Fury
Line: That thing in your chest is based on unfinished technology.

Name: Tony
Line: No, it was finished. It has never been particularly effective until I miniaturised it and put it in my…

Name: Fury
Line: No. Howard said the arc reactor was the stepping stone to something greater. He was about to kick off an energy race that was gonna dwarf the arms race. He was on to something big, something so big that it was gonna make the nuclear reactor look like a triple-A battery.

Name: Tony
Line: Just him, or Anton Vanko in on this too?

Name: Fury
Line: Anton Vanko is the other side of that coin. Anton saw it as a way to get rich. When your father found out, he had him deported. When the Russians found out he couldn’t deliver they shipped his ass off to Siberia and he spent the next 20 years in a vodka-fuelled rage. Not quite the environment you want to raise a kid in, the son you had the misfortune of crossing paths with in Monaco.

Name: Tony
Line: You told me I hadn’t tried everything. What do you mean I haven’t tried everything? What haven’t I tried?

Name: Fury
Line: He said that you were the only person with the means and knowledge to finish what he started.

Name: Tony
Line: He said that?

Name: Fury
Line: Are you that guy? Are you? ‘Cause if you are, then you can solve the riddle of your heart.

Name: Tony
Line: I don’t know where you get your information, but he wasn’t my biggest fan.

Name: Fury
Line: What do you remember about your dad?

Name: Tony
Line: He was cold, he was calculating. He never told me he loved me. He never even told me he liked me, so it’s a little tough for me to digest when you’re telling me he said the whole future was riding on me and he’s passing it down. I don’t get that. You’re talking about a guy who’s happiest day was when he shipped me off to boarding school.

Name: Fury
Line: That’s not true.

Name: Tony
Line: Well, then, clearly you knew my dad better than I did.

Name: Fury
Line: As a matter of fact, I did. He was one of the founding members of SHIELD.

Name: Tony
Line: What?

Name: Fury
Line: I got a two o’clock

Name: Tony
Line: Wait, wait, wait, wait. What’s this?

Name: Fury
Line: Okay, you’re good, right?

Name: Tony
Line: No, I’m not good.

Name: Fury
Line: You got this? Right? Right?

Name: Tony
Line: Got what? I don’t even know what I’m supposed to get.

Name: Fury
Line: Natasha will remain a floater at Stark with her cover intact. You remember Agent Coulson, right?

Name: Tony
Line: Yeah.

Name: Fury
Line: And Tony, remember, I got my eye on you. [Fury leaves]

Name: Tony
Line: [Turning to Agent Coulson] Please. First thing, I need a little bodywork. I’ll put in a little time at the lab. If we could send one of your goon squad down to The Coffee Bean, Cross Creek, for a Starbucks run, or something like that, that’d be nice.

Name: Tony
Line: I think I got it, yeah.

Name: Rhodey
Line: Major, this is not a scientific exercise. Let’s just focus on arming it, all right?

Name: Justin
Line: [Entering. Sucking on a red lollipop.] Oh, yes! Oh, yes, yes, yes. Is it my birthday? You got it. What did you do? What did you do? Is this what I think it is?

Name: Rhodey
Line: Yes it is. Hammer, I want to know what you’re gonna do for us.

Name: Justin
Line: What am I going to do for you? Well, the first thing I’m gonna do for you is I’m gonna upgrade your software. And then, second, I think I should…

Name: Rhodey
Line: That’s not what I’m talking about. I’m talking about firepower.

Name: Justin
Line: Well, you’re talking to the right guy. [Bites lollipop. Time jump. Kind of. He now has weapons to show to Rhodey.] Claridge Hi-Tec, semi-automatic, 9mm pistol. Too downtown? I agree. M24 shotgun, pump action. Five-round magazine. You know what? You’re not a hunter. What am I talking about? I’m getting rid of it. This is the FN-2000 from Belgium. They do make something better than waffles. It’s beautiful, But I can tell this isn’t disco enough for you, so I’m gonna put it right here. You’re looking at a Milkor 40mm grenade launcher. Tear gas, smoke. Hippie control. You’re tough. Let me tell you something. Size does matter. Don’t let anyone tell you different. This is an M134 7.62 Minigun. Six invidual barrels. The torso taker, powder maker. Our boys in uniform call in Uncle Gazpacho or Puff the Magic Dragon. Okay. These are the Cubans, baby. This is the Cohibas, the Montecristos. This is a kinetic-kill, side-winder vehicle with a secondary cyclotrimethlyenetrinitamine RDX burst. It’s capable of busting the bunker under the bunker you just busted. If it were any smarter, it would write a book. A book that would make Ulysses look like it was written in crayon. It would read it to you. This is my Eiffel Tower. This is my Rachmaninoff’s Third. My Pieta. It’s completely elegant. It’s bafflingly beautiful. And it’s capable of reducing the population of any standing structure to zero. I call it the Ex-Wife. That’s the best I got. Are we gonna do this? Give me something here. You’re like a sphinx. I can’t read you.

Name: Rhodey
Line: I think I’ll take it.

Name: Justin
Line: Which one?

Name: Rhodey
Line: All of it.

Name: Justin
Line: All of it.

Name: Tony
Line: I don’t have any dough. Here. [Takes off watch]

Name: Tony
Line: No, it’s fine. Take that. It’s fine

Name: Tony
Line: Take it. Take it. I don’t like people handing me things. If you just drop that there, that’d be great.

Name: Tony
Line: Sometimes.

Name: Pepper
Line: It was an illegal seizure of trademark property.

Name: Tony
Line: Relax.

Name: Tony
Line: Is here.

Name: Tony
Line: I don’t. It’s fine. I’ll just be a second.

Name: Pepper
Line: No, the suit belongs to us.

Name: Pepper
Line: Yeah, but you’re not…

Name: Pepper
Line: Burt…

Name: Pepper
Line: Yes, it does.

Name: Pepper
Line: No.

Name: Tony
Line: Mute.

Name: Pepper
Line: No… Burt… Burt… Burt, listen to me. Don’t tell me that we have the best patent lawyers in the country and then not let me pursue this.

Name: Tony
Line: [Looking at boxes and things in the corner.] I’ll get this stuff out of here.

Name: Pepper
Line: Well, then, tell the President to sign an order. We’ll talk about it at the Expo. [Tony pulls back a sheet and finds the same model as that that was in the video with his father] Hammer’s giving some presentation tomorrow evening. Will Tony Stark be there?

Name: Tony
Line: [Pulling up a chair] Will I?

Name: Pepper
